https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: New loan product – the energy efficiency renovation loan
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Renovate your apartment and save money due to energy efficiency and in one go. In order to stimulate energy conservation banking sector suggests a range of solutions. Byblos Bank Armenia offers a new loan product to the market – the energy efficiency renovation loan. Energy efficiency renovation loan is a unique product for the Armenian market. It is targeted to every citizen of Armenia who wants to renovate apartment and save money by reducing energy consumption costs. The renovation loan payment is due within 15 years. The loan interest rate is unprecedentedly low – only 10% annually. This loan offers an optimal solution to apartment renovation, gives opportunity to get sustainable building materials and save energy during regular use of heating and cooling systems which consequently reduces electricity bills. An energy efficient apartment results in accruing long-term saving. The sum of monthly savings can make up a considerable amount over years, which can be used for paying loan principal. Undoubtedly, an apartment with such a renovation will have higher market value in the future.  Energy efficiency renovation loan has already gained popularity among Byblos Bank Armenia clients. Providing renovation loans by convenient conditions Byblos Bank Armenia expects to expand loan portfolio of bank and to foster energy saving culture development in Armenia. On the macro level such programs provide opportunity for nature conservation and economic development in the country by reducing energy consumption and increasing the population's welfare. Energy Efficiency Renovation Loan, renovate your house and start living a better life.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Byblos Bank Armenia - Five Years in Armenia
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Byblos Bank Group operates in 12 countries around the world, including Armenia. Since its foundation for over 60 years Byblos Bank has been a responsible and reliable partner in every region of its operations.     Byblos Bank Armenia enetered Armenian banking industry five years ago, in 2007. Mainly due to contribution to Armenian-Lebanese investments and financial collaboration Byblos Bank has positioned itself in a unique niche. Byblos Bank Armenia is guided by five main principles: integrity, customer focus, mutual respect, professionalism and teamwork. These principles serve as a base for Byblos Bank Armenia to successively expand the services offered to individuals and legal entities.   During five years Byblos Bank Armenia has been developing loan packages and services with convenient conditions, which support enhancement of the Bank’s portfolio. The Bank provides a range of competitive products, five of which are worth to distinguish: Easy Save account, Personal Loan, Small Business Loan, Housing Loan, as well as a unique product recently introduced to the market – Energy Efficiency Renovation loan.  Special Approach to Savings  In order to manage clients' savings efficiently, Byblos Bank Armenia offers its Easy Save account. It allows You not only to accumulate money through fast and simple transactions at any time, but also to get competitive interest rate on the positive balance of the account - 6% annually.   Your Bank For Life Personal loan provided by Byblos Bank Armenia is aimed to cover current expenses of physical entities. Due to this type of loan, the consumer is able to purchase household appliances and high-technology equipment, as well as to realize some major plans such as payment for education, traveling or simply to finance unexpected expenses. The Personal Loan provided by Byblos Bank Armenia is unique for simplicity of application procedures, favourable conditions and competitive interest rates.   Small Business Loan - Big Opportunities  Given the fact that financing is half the battle for any business, Byblos Bank Armenia responds to the local market needs and provides unprecedented program of small business loans. This loan is provided to individual entrepreneurs, limited liability companies and other types of legal entities registered in RA, where the number of employees doesn't exceed forty-nine. This loan is provided for meeting any needs of any type of business - whether offering professional services, products or managing workshop crafted production. The loan can be used to expand the working capital as well as to obtain equipment, purchase or enlarge the office/work space.    New Year with a New Home Due to the Housing Loan of Byblos Bank Armenia it is possible to fulfill the dream to own an apartment. The Bank may finance up-to 70% of your apartment’s value. The loan repayment is due within 2-15 years while the annual interest rate of loan is 12%-14% when provided in US Dollars and 14%-16% when provided in Armenian Drams.      Renovated Apartment and Energy Saving in One Go The Energy Efficiency Renovation loan is a project that BBAM has recently luanched. Aim of this project is to increase welfare of RA population by reducing costs of energy consumption. This renovation loan is intended for every citizen of Armenia, who wants to renovate apartment and direct energy savings to loan repayment. The repayment of loan is due within 15 years whereas loan annual interest rate is unprecedentedly low – only 10%.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: LAV ELI Exclusive Concert – Bank’s Gift to Vanadzor
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: On July 4 LAV ELI Rock Band held an open air concert in Hayk Square in Vanadzor. The concert marked the one-year anniversary of Byblos Bank Armenia’s Vanazdor Branch. The public had an opportunity to enjoy the old and new songs of the band. The concert was organized on the occasion of Byblos Bank Armenia’s Vanadzor Branch anniversary. This was a good opportunity for people to come together with families and friends and spend value time in Vanadzor. The event united not only LAV ELI band but also the active youth of Vanadzor as well as guests and visitors from Yerevan and the regions. The audience participated in quiz games and received keepsakes from Byblos Bank Armenia. The Vanzdor Branch of Byblos Bank Armenia opened a year ago and introduced new quality and international standards in the banking sector. The Vanadzor branch operates transparently and responsibly in accordance to the key principles of Byblos Bank Group. The branch offers diverse loan packages. “We are happy to combine the anniversary of Byblos Bank Armenia’s Vanadzor Branch and the concert of LAV ELI rock band. The city of Vanadzor is known for its long standing traditions of rock music. This event fosters the cultural growth of the environment where we work”, said Krist Marukyan, Vanadzor Branch Manager.  LAV ELI formed in the mid-90s in Vanazdor. In the years to follow the band became quite popular. However, by early 2000’s the band separated. Now, years later LAV ELI has reunited:“Almost the whole band came together. We have a unique opportunity to perform for Vanadzor public and guests with this long-awaited concert.” said Mher Manukyan, a member of LAV ELI. Byblos Bank Armenia readily supported this initiative since it values the importance of cultural activities not only in the capital but also throughout the regions. Besides supporting LAV ELI concert, Byblos Bank Armenia continuously expands its support with education, culture and energy efficiency programs.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: A Day With Byblos Bank․ Study Tour Of AYB High School Students
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: On June 19, 2012 the Ayb high school students visited Byblos Bank Armenia’s head office and Amiryan branch to get acquainted with the Bank's procedures and daily activities, as well as the nuances of banking. This was a reciprocal visit by Ayb students to Byblos Bank. Eleven students with sucess record in courses such as math and economics were selected to participate. After the meeting with the Byblos Bank Armenia's CEO Ararat Ghukasyan, the students continued their tour with the Bank's employees. During the comprehensive program the students learnt about the Bank's services and products, employment opportunities and HR recruitment procedures, the structure of the branches, departments and their functions. According to Special Education Programs deputy director at Ayb, Viguen Shirvanyan, the cooperation with Byblos Bank has a tendency to expand. Meeting with the CEO and the head staff to receive first-hand information is very important for the students to choose their future career. Students may wish to change or pursue careers in banking after being encouraged by this meeting, said Mr. Shirvanyan. Ayb students were particularly interested in internships and job opportunities at Byblos Bank.It is nice, that Byblos Bank initated such a project. This visit is very important for our future professional orientation. Receiving this much information is an asset, and the Bank’s staff is very friendly too. I would like to work and gain experience at this age, - mentioned Sirarpi Ghasabyan, an 11th grade student at Ayb high school who plans to specialize in banking. The first meeting with Ayb students and Byblos Bank Armenia was organized this May, when the CEO Mr. Ghukasyan presented the world history of banking including Armenia as well as the functions of a bank during the Lunch Hour Lecture series at Ayb school. ”Byblos Bank Armenia supports the development of education in Armenia both with the provision of financial and human resources as well as by sharing knowledge. We hope, that this initiative with Ayb high school was an opportunity for the students to be more informed and prepared to make the right decision in choosing their profession,- mentioned Mr. Ghukasyan. Highlighting the role of education in having prosperous country and competitive professionals, since its foundation Byblos Bank Armenia has been cooperating with the American University of Armenia and Ayb high school since 2012. In 2012 Byblos Bank Armenia will continue to expand the portfolio of Corporate Social Responsibility in the spheres of education and promoting energy efficiency programs.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Bank History Lecture at AYB High School
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Over 70 students of Ayb high school had an opportunity to learn about the history and development of banking business. The CEO of Byblos Bank Armenia Mr. Ararat Ghukasyan presented the world history of banking including Armenia as well as the functions of a bank during the Lunch Hour Lecture series at Ayb School.  The students actively participated in the discussion and the Q&A session. An Ayb student, Narek who wants to become a diplomat in the future thinks everybody must know about banking history. This is important to know both as a citizen and as a future professional.  “I have learned a lot about banking during this lecture. The topic of banking evolution was particularly important, since we cannot make deals with banks correctly unless we know the underlying history and principles. This knowledge may play an important role in my future career as well”, said Narek.  Mr. Ghukasyan also presented the key principles of banking business which are the mutual trust and professionalism. Byblos Bank Armenia pays much attention to fostering the development of education. At the end of the meeting Mr. Ghukasyan encouraged the students to study hard, since education and knowledge are the only true guarantees of successful and dignified life.  In the near future Ayb school students will have an on-site visit to one of the Byblos Bank Armenia branches. During the job shadowing visit the students will learn about the bank operations and will have discussions with the Byblos staff.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: New Branch on Komitas street
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Yerevan, Armenia, April 18, 2012 - Byblos Bank Armenia (BBA) officially opened a new branch in Komitas district of Yerevan. Komitas branch, the 3rd of BBA in Yerevan, ensures access to banking services for its clients residing in Komitas and neighboring districts. BBA leadership, representatives of Central Bank Armenia and businesses were among the guests at the opening ceremony. In line with Byblos Group’s policy, BBA Komitas branch is identical to all other Byblos Bank branches in Armenia and abroad, which ensures branch recognition and consistent customer experience. “Komitas is an important residential and business area with good growth and development potential. We believe Komitas has got an adequate capacity for banking services, hence a decision was made to ensure our permanent presence here.”- said Mr. Palikyan, the Manager of BBA Komitas branch. Komitas branch continues the 60 years of Byblos Group’s best traditions and offers beneficial products and services to the Bank’s customers and stakeholders. “By opening a new branch in Komitas, we demonstrate our strategic approach towards developing branch network for improving and facilitating access of our clients to quality banking services.”- said Mr. Ghukasyan, the CEO of BBA. In 2012 BBA recorded many great successes. In the first quarter the Bank secured steady growth in all directions, including assets, deposits and loans. BBA signed a long- term funding agreement with IFC. In order to expand new services and products the Bank plans to enter into similar agreements with other international organizations as well.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Byblos Bank Armenia Presented Prospects of Armenian Banking Sector in Lebanon
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Byblos Bank Armenia Presented Prospects of Armenian Banking Sector in LebanonThe Armenian-Lebanese roundtable entitled “New Realities of Armenian Baking System” took place on March 29-31, 2012. The round table brought together leaders of investment banking and business circles from both countries. Headquartered in Lebanon and with presence in Armenia, Byblos Bank is well-positioned to introduce specifics of banking system in Armenia to their Lebanese colleagues, therefore Byblos Bank Armenia CEO, Mr. Ghukasyan was the part of the delegation from Armenia.During this official visit Mr. Ghukasyan presented Armenia’s financial system and economy to individuals and companies in Lebanon interested in expanding their business and investments in Armenia. Byblos Bank Armenia played this liaising role in the past and managed to bring its valuable input throughout round table discussions as well.“This was an excellent opportunity to restate to larger Armenian community in Lebanon about Byblos Group’s presence in Armenia and long-term growth plans. We are in Armenia to facilitate trade, commerce and investments between two friendly nations and countries.” noted the Chief Executive Officer of Byblos Bank Armenia.Being one of the top three banks in Lebanon, Byblos Bank is well known to the Armenian Diaspora that plays active political, economic and social role in strengthening bilateral relations. With well-established banking systems both in Lebanon and Armenia, the Bank serves the expending clientele in both countries.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: IFC Helps Bank Boost Mortgage and Residential Energy-Efficiency Lending
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: IFC Helps Byblos Bank Armenia Boost Mortgage and Residential Energy-Efficiency Lending Yerevan, Armenia, March 27, 2012—IFC, a member of the World Bank Group, is partnering with Byblos Bank Armenia to help it expand mortgage lending and offer residential energy-efficiency financing, helping save energy resources and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. IFC is providing a $10 million loan to Byblos Bank Armenia to offer its clients increased access to housing finance and also to the first-ever residential energy-efficiency lending package offered by a local bank in Armenia. Byblos Bank Armenia will design its energy-efficiency products with advisory support from IFC’s Armenia Sustainable Energy Finance Project. Ararat Ghukasyan, Chief Executive Officer of Byblos Bank Armenia, said, “By promoting energy efficiency and energy-efficient lending products, we can help homeowners in Armenia to reduce their annual energy bills, lead more environmentally friendly lifestyles, and improve the health, comfort, and safety of their homes. This is the first funding of this nature in Armenia, hence it is equally important to our customers and to Byblos Bank Armenia.” Tomasz Telma, IFC Director for Europe and Central Asia, said: “Our strategy in Armenia is to increase access to finance, including energy-efficiency finance, and to encourage sustainable economic growth, support job creation, and diversify the country’s economic base. By working with financial intermediaries such as Byblos Bank Armenia we can achieve significant development impact in a country that relies heavily on energy imports.” IFC will provide training for Byblos Bank Armenia credit officers and risk specialists to educate them in assessing risks and processing energy-efficiency loan applications. Armenia, a country with few fossil energy resources, has strong demand for energy efficiency because of the high cost of energy. Since Armenia became a member of IFC in 1995, IFC has invested $202 million in 35 projects across the industry spectrum, including financial markets, manufacturing, and mining. IFC Advisory Services also provides advice through projects focusing on the financial sector, sustainable energy, and regulatory simplification. IFC’s Armenia Sustainable Energy Finance Project is being implemented in partnership with the Austrian Ministry of Finance. About IFCIFC, a member of the World Bank Group, is the largest global development institution focused exclusively on the private sector. We help developing countries achieve sustainable growth by financing investment, providing advisory services to businesses and governments, and mobilizing capital in the international financial markets. In fiscal 2011, amid economic uncertainty across the globe, we helped our clients create jobs, strengthen environmental performance, and contribute to their local communities—all while driving our investments to an all-time high of nearly $19 billion. For more information, visit www.ifc.org.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: New House Loan Special Offer by Byblos Bank Armenia
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Byblos Bank Armenia is committed to providing beneficial products to its clients. The Bank makes a special offer of a house loan till March 31. Your New House loan enables the clients to purchase a house or an apartment with exclusive conditions - 0% file fee, only 20% down payment and 11% fixed interest rate.With Your New House loan the Bank will finance up to 80% of the value for any apartment or house selected by the client. The tenor for the loan is up to15 years. These exceptional conditions of the loan will enable to save time and money, and own today a dream house for the price of a monthly rent. Starting from April 1 Byblos Bank Armenia will continue the usual offer with 11% fixed rate and 15 year tenor. This offer will have a file fee of 0.5% (min AMD 50,000 max AMD 250,000). The loan finances 70% of the appraised value of the finished apartment/house or the sale price whichever is less.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Bank is a registered member of NASCAD OMX Armenia
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Membership with NASDAQ OMX Armenia gives the Bank access to all markets, including corporate and government securities, REPOs, as well as enables to conclude manual trades via the exchange trading system and to participate in NASDAQ OMX Armenia rule making process.“Armenian Stock Exchange”, NASDAQ, is the only stock exchange operating in Armenia. It provides transparent exchange market that enables Armenian companies to raise capital and contribute to the development of the country’s economy.Byblos Bank Armenia brings its values to the family of about 4000 globally trusted businesses and brands registered with NASDAQ Armenia.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: 2011 Summary
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: 2011 has been a remarkable year for Byblos Bank Armenia thanks to completion of   major financial deals and implementation of programs. The bank has succeeded to enter into several agreements with international financial institutions and is looking forward to the new ones which will be focused on the development of small and medium businesses. Byblos Bank Armenia cooperates with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD1) in facilitating funding to private businesses. In line with earlier signed agreement between EBRD and Byblos Bank Armenia throughout 2011 the total amount USD 5 million facility granted to the bank has been utilized fully  among Armenian commercial entities operating in the  following sectors: manufacturing, services and food processing. According to the contract recently signed between Byblos Bank Armenia and European Fund for Southeast Europe (EFSE2) Bank has been granted two facilities in the amounts of AMD 875 million and USD 3 million. These funds will be used to finance small and medium size businesses in Armenia. “Byblos Bank Armenia has finalised negotiations with other international financial institutions for attracting large-scale and long-term funds during the first quarter of the coming year. The new funds will be aimed at the financing of small and medium-size entities, as well as will promoting mortgage lending ” – said Mr. Ararat Ghukasyan, Chief Executive Officer of Byblos Bank Armenia.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: New branch in Vanadzor
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Byblos Bank Armenia, Yerevan, July 21, 2011: Yesterday Byblos Bank Armenia opened a state-of-the-art branch in Vanadzor, in the earthquake zone during a ceremony attended by a delegation of Byblos Bank Group, representatives from Central Bank of Armenia, Mayor’s office, Bank’s Management, important corporate clients, partners, media and other guests. The new branch, which is launched in a prime location, confirms the Bank’s engagement to extend its high-quality products and services to the residents of the earthquake area and to efficiently contribute to the local economy’s prosperity. Mr. Alain Tohmé, Member of the Board of Directors of Byblos Bank Group, said: “Our commitment towards Armenia and the Armenian people remains true and we look forward to playing a key role in the development of Vanadzor and its nearby areas”. He added: “Our establishment in Armenia in 2007 was not a hazardous step but a planned one because we know that there is room for long-term growth and investment. Today, our strategy is gaining traction and the purchase of the Vanadzor premises is a clear sign of our long-term commitment.” Mr. Ararat Ghukasyan, CEO of Byblos Bank Armenia, said: “As an Armenian banker, I am extremely pleased to be part of Byblos Bank Group. We are now able to reach the northern regions of Armenia through our modern branch in Vanadzor. Our aim is to encompass the Lori, Shirak and Tavush regions. Our expansion strategy also includes the opening of a new branch in Komitas that will be operational by the end of the year.” It was last year, on the 1988 Earthquake’s Remembrance Day, that Byblos Bank Armenia announced its will to expand and invest in Vanadzor. In keeping with its international quality, the new branch has been furbished according to Byblos Bank Group standards. Through 10 new work stations, a trained staff offers friendly and professional banking services such as corporate and consumer lending, with an emphasis on small and middle enterprises. The purpose is to boost the growth of small businesses and sustain them. Byblos Bank Group is an international financial institution that operates in 12 countries: Armenia, Lebanon, France, United Kingdom, Belgium, Cyprus, Iraq, Nigeria, Sudan, Syria, United Arab Emirates, and Democratic Republic of the Congo. In 2010, the Group’s consolidated net profit increased by 22.1% to USD 177.7 million as compared to 2009, total assets increased by 12.6% to USD 15.3 billion, and customers’ deposits grew by 15.6% to USD 11.9 billion. This year, Byblos Bank also posted the highest rise in Tier One Capital among Lebanese banks and jumped 58 places in The Banker Magazine’s ranking list of the Top 1,000 commercial banks in the world.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Byblos Bank Armenia cjsc the best cooperating bank of the year
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: During a January 24 Press Conference held by the Financial System Mediator (FSM) on the occasion of its second anniversary, Byblos Bank Armenia CJSC was nominated as one of the three best cooperating banks in Armenia. Byblos Bank Armenia highly regards this nomination bestowed upon it by such a highly respected institution. Our commitment to swift problem-solving and feasible approach in bank-client relations is genuine proof of our long-term and sound banking strategy in the Armenian market.  On the occasion of the second anniversary of the FMS, Byblos Bank Armenia would like to congratulate and reaffirm its close continuous cooperation for the further development of the banking industry in Armenia.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: 5 mln USD financing to support private businesses
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: OPEC Fund for International Development (OFID) and Byblos Bank Armenia together finance small and medium businesses, operating in Armenia. Byblos Bank Armenia started its USD 5 mln financing program of middle market companies late December 2010. The agreement with OFID provides funds for financing the lending program. The funds sourced will be granted to small and medium size enterprises, operating in Armenia, for up to 5 years and at preferential rates, enhancing the availability of financing for this field, an important one for the development of the economy. About OFIDOPEC Fund for International Development is a diversified financial institution, established on 1976 by the member-countries of OPEC. Types of financing include lending for business development and similar projects, assistance to the balance of payments and redemption of borrowings upon the initiative of heavily indebted poor countries (HIPC) organization, support to private businesses, grants as technical assistance, food aid, research and humanitarian aid, as well as provision of resources to other organizations, aimed at development and acting to support developing countries. As of Aug 31, 2009 total investments amounted to USD 11 billion.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Bank completes its three years of operations and engages to more development in the earthquake zone
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Armenia, Yerevan. December 7, 2010 – The Board of Directors of Byblos Bank Armenia and Byblos Bank Group held their Annual General Meetings on December 7 to discuss the strategy of the Bank’s international and local operations. The short summary of Byblos Bank Armenia’s three years of operations in Armenia and the plans on further expansion in the Republic came in an announcement at press conference held on December 7. The press conference that followed the annual meeting at Armenia Marriott Hotel was led by Dr. François Bassil, the chairman of Byblos Bank Group and Byblos Bank Armenia CJSC Board, with the participation of the following speakers:  Mr. Ararat Ghoukasyan, Byblos Bank Armenia CEO, Mr. Alain Tohme, Byblos Bank Armenia CJSC Board Member, and Alain Wanna, Byblos Bank Armenia CJSC Board Member. The EBRD shareholder was also present. As an international financial institution, Byblos Bank Group currently operates in 12 countries, such as Armenia, Belgium, Congo, Cyprus, France, Iraq, Lebanon, Nigeria, Sudan, Syria, UK, UAE. “It was in 2007 that our Bank first established a foothold in Armenia, a country that we hold so dear to our hearts. Armenia and Lebanon have always maintained strong ties and share many common qualities.” Said Dr. Bassil while presenting the prospects of the expansion of Lebanese Byblos Bank Group. “After an initial stabilization period, we are looking to 2011 to being the year of our “real” start in Armenia,” said the Chairman. Byblos Bank Armenia will offer new services such as commercial loan portfolio, with an emphasis on Small and Middle Enterprises. “Our objectives are to grow, go beyond Yerevan. It is symbolic, that today on the 1988 Earthquake’s Remembrance Day, we are announcing our expansion and investment plans in Vanadzor, which was one of the regions severely affected by the earthquake,” highlighted Dr. Bassil.  The opening of the Vanadzor branch at a new location will offer news jobs for the residents of the earthquake-struck areas. The Chairman then concluded by expressing his confidence that ‘Byblos Bank Group’s unwavering long term commitment will actively contribute to the economic prosperity of Armenia.’ This process will also contribute to ‘developing even stronger relations between the peoples of Armenia and Lebanon.’

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Ararat Ghukasyan appointed new Chief Executive Officer of Byblos Bank Armenia CJSC
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: On 25 August 2010, the Board of the Central Bank of Armenia has approved the appointment of Mr. Ararat Ghukasyan as the new Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Byblos Bank Armenia C.J.S.C.Mr. Ararat Ghukasyan is currently serving as the Chairman of the Union of Banks. During his long and successful career in the financial business, he held several positions in different banks, locally and internationally.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Byblos Bank in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Byblos Bank Headquarters, Ashrafieh – April 2010: Byblos Bank started this month operations in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The Bank has taken in the majority of the shares of “Banque Solidaire”, which is now running under the name of Byblos Bank DR Congo. This step comes in the framework of the Bank’s expansion strategy aimed at reinforcing its position as a regional player gaining ground worldwide while capitalizing on an expertise of more than 60 years in the financial and banking sectors. Dr. François S. Bassil, Chairman and General Manager of the Byblos Bank Group, stated that “Byblos Bank’s expansion strategy is focused on leveraging its extensive expertise to establish solid foundations for its operations and tap challenging and under-served markets, the latest of which is the Democratic Republic of the Congo”. Emerging markets will bolster Byblos Bank’s capital base and financial capacities, thus contributing to broadening its client base, as well as its products and services. By expanding in the Congolese promising market, Byblos Bank can also accompany the Lebanese Diaspora spread throughout the African continent, and support local and foreign investors in the development of their businesses and the concretization of their projects. The newly acquired entity in Kinshasa is operating as an independent subsidiary of the Byblos Bank Group. It will provide value-added services such as corporate banking, commercial banking, investment services, and consumer banking. This step comes to reinforce Byblos Bank’s position and strengthen its regional and international presence in 12 countries and three continents: Lebanon, Belgium, France, United Kingdom, Cyprus, Syria, United Arab Emirates, Iraq, Armenia, Sudan, Nigeria, and lately the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: Byblos Bank Honors the President of the National Assembly of the Republic of Armenia
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: Byblos Bank Headquarters, Ashrafieh, 13 April 2010: Dr. François S. Bassil, Chairman and General Manager of Byblos Bank Group, hosted a luncheon in honor of Mr. Hovik Abrahamyan, President of the National Assembly of the Republic of Armenia and the delegation accompanying him in his official visit to Lebanon. The luncheon was held at Le Maillon restaurant in the presence of eminent political and social figures, as well as high-profile businessmen and Byblos Bank Group managers. In his welcome speech, Dr. Bassil praised the close relationships between Byblos Bank, the only Lebanese bank that established a foothold in Armenia back in 2007, and the Armenian people. He said, “Armenians have a fair share in our Group both as shareholders and clients. Our Bank works towards promoting cooperation among the Armenian Diaspora, wherever it may be in general, and between Armenians of Lebanon and Armenia in particular”. Dr. Bassil added: “The Armenian economy is a promising one of its own accord. It boasts sufficient natural and human resources to support considerable economic growth. In keeping with Byblos Bank’s strategy of contributing meaningfully to the development of the societies where we operate, Byblos Bank’s policy in Armenia is to invigorate both the productive sectors of the economy and the consumption practices that sustain them. This means financing for both industry and services, as well as housing, personal, and professional loans at the retail level, which will contribute to expanding the size of Armenia’s middle class, upgrading the quality of life for its citizens, and supporting the country’s plans for steady, long-term economic growth”. Then, highlighting the similarities that Armenia and Lebanon share, Dr. Bassil commended the strong partnership and friendship between both countries. “Armenia is a country that boasts a rich cultural heritage that stems from one of the oldest civilizations on earth”, he said. “Like the Lebanese, the Armenian people are open-minded, dynamic, and productive. They refuse laziness and dependency, and they earnestly strive to improve their living conditions and education. They also reject any attempts against their freedom or dignity. Hence, they are people who deserve life, and we have great respect and esteem towards them”. Mr. Hovik Abrahamyan thanked Dr. Bassil for his significant initiative. He also expressed his pride in Lebanon and  thanked the Lebanese authorities for embracing the Armenian community  and for showing Armenians  such a great respect and support. He added: “We will strive to enhance economic relations between Lebanon and Armenia, so that they will be as fruitful as the political cooperation established between both countries”. It is worth to note that Byblos Bank operates in the Republic of Armenia through three branches, offering a myriad of banking products and services such as commercial lending, project financing, asset management, private banking, personal banking, and consumer banking.

https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.title_en: EBRD’s first local currency financing in Armenia
https://www.byblosbankarmenia.am/en/arti.content_en: The EBRD facility, for on-lending to private enterprises, includes a synthetic loan in Armenian Dram (AMD) for an amount equivalent to up to $5 million, which will be used to finance investments and working capital needs of local businesses, and an additional $5 million to co-finance Byblos Bank Armenia’s larger sub-loans. Under the synthetic loan structure, the EBRD is providing the financing in US dollars at a pre-determined fixed USD/AMD exchange rate. Byblos Bank Armenia’s loan obligation is therefore the AMD counter-value of the provided funds. The synthetic local currency loan will help Byblos Bank Armenia reduce its foreign exchange risk, increase the term of its local currency funding, and expand its portfolio of loans in local currency. The EBRD funds will enable Byblos Bank Armenia to facilitate the access to much needed financing for businesses operating in the country in the current tight credit market. “This transaction will boost the financial intermediation in the Armenian banking sector, bringing new financing in local currency to the country’s real economy. The EBRD funds will support further development of the private sector, addressing an important constraint for the economic growth in Armenia”, said Mike Taylor, EBRD Director, Financial Institutions, Central Asia, Caucasus, and Mongolia. “Byblos Bank Armenia welcomes the EBRD’s facility in order to jointly support the private businesses in the Republic of Armenia. It demonstrates EBRD's confidence in the strength of our bank and in the economy of the country. This transaction will further allow us to pursue our expansion strategy in the market”, said Mr. Georges Sfeir, CEO of Byblos Bank Armenia. Since the beginning of its operations in Armenia, the EBRD has committed over €335 million in approximately 70 projects in the financial, corporate, infrastructure and energy sectors. About EBRD: The EBRD, owned by 61 countries and two intergovernmental institutions, is supporting the development of market economies and democracies in countries from central Europe to central Asia. For further information, visit: www.ebrd.com
